intro: Luzula campestris var. pallens, commonly known as the pale sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks. Its slender, triangular stems are often tinged with pale green or silver, giving it a distinctive appearance. The inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, spike-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
